stories.text:
Just curious if the number of players at any poker table would alter a capable AI/ML's chances of winning?

I don't see how it would, so long as every player was playing fair, it should not matter if the unknown cards were dealt to more players or still in the deck. To me at least.

I know poker but very little about AI/ML/Solvers.
stories.title: Ask HN: Would it be any more difficult for AI/ML to beat more poker players?

PFAS in indoor air linked to cancer
What do you think of this new audio content format that's interactive?

stories.text:
1/ Waterproof wall or dyke that shields the house.

2/ Waterproof doors and windows.

3/ Vent-like holes in the floor at the entrances that suck water and reroute it out of the house through a pump.

4/ Spray-on substance that can be used to seal doors and windows temporarily.

5/ Structural frame below the house that can lift it.

6/ House is mobile home which can be lifted by a crane.

7/ House is a house boat which can be untethered from the ground so it floats.

Do these sound workable? Any other ideas?
stories.title: Ask HN: How can we prevent flooding in houses using technology?
Science project reveals high lead levels in U.K. schools’ water
